title: Essex lorry murder suspect Mo Robinson "is 100% innocent" says close friend
text:

A close friend of a man arrested on suspicion of murder after 39 bodies were discovered in a lorry container has insisted he is "100% innocent".

Mo Robinson, 25, from Portadown, Northern Ireland, has been named locally as the man being held by police following the grim discovery on an industrial estate in Grays, Essex this morning.

A pal told Mirror.co.uk: "He is my friend, a good friend of mine...the man is 100% innocent."

On Mo's Facebook page, several photos appear to feature the same lorry involved in the horror find.

His family, from Co Armagh, told Belfast Live they hadn't "heard from him" and "don't know what is going on".

(Image: REUTERS)

(Image: SWNS)

And they said they didn't know if the lorry driver had been working alone or for a haulage firm.

The murder probe was launched in the early hours of this morning after 39 dead bodies - including a teenager were found.

Cops rushed to Waterglade International Park in Grays, Essex, at 1.40am after paramedics alerted them to the tragedy.

Det Con Pippa Mills said officers were unable to identify the bodies at a press conference this morning.

(Image: Supplied)

The grisly find has sparked one of the biggest 'mass murder' probes in British history - and has been described by police as an "absolute tragedy".

Nearby CCTV captured the lorry making its final journey to the industrial estate - less than an hour before the shock discovery.

Earlier this evening police removed the lorry and took it to a secure location "to maintain the dignity of those who have lost their lives,” police say.

Police officers bowed their heads as the vehicle passed by.

Essex Police say they believe the lorry travelled from Zeebrugge, Belgium, into the port of Purfleet in eastern England.

(Image: PA)

(Image: SWNS.com)

The vehicle then docked in the Thurrock area at around 12.30am local time for just over half an hour before moving again.

And the tractor unit is believed to have originated in Northern Ireland.

In a statement, police said: "Our detectives are continuing their investigation into the events in Grays this morning, Wednesday 23 October.

"We were called shortly after 1.40am by our colleagues in the East of England Ambulance Service to reports that, sadly, 39 people had been discovered dead in the container of a lorry at the Waterglade Industrial Park in Eastern Avenue.

"Originally, we reported that the lorry had travelled into the country through Holyhead on Saturday 19 October.

"After further enquiries, we now believe that the trailer travelled from Zeebrugge into Purfleet, and docked in the Thurrock area shortly after 12:30am this morning. The tractor unit of the lorry is believed to have originated in Northern Ireland.

"We believe the lorry and trailer left the port shortly after 1.05am.

"The driver of the lorry, a 25-year-old man from Northern Ireland, remains in custody having been arrested on suspicion of murder.

"A cordon has remained in place at Eastern Avenue for most of the day and this remains in place.

"We thank everyone in the area, especially residents and local businesses, for their patience and compassion throughout the day.

"This will be a lengthy and complex investigation and we continue to work with local partners and international authorities to gather vital intelligence and identify those who have sadly died.

"We urge anyone with information to contact our Major Investigation Team on 101 or visit our website."
description: EXCLUSIVE: The murder probe was launched in the early hours of this morning after 39 dead bodies - including a teenager - were discovered in a lorry in Grays
